metadata.case_name: Bisheshwar Dayal Sinha v. University of Bihar

facts.text: Rajendra College, Chapra, is an educational institution admitted by the Bihar University as a College under section 2(d) of the Bihar State Universities Act (Bihar Act XIV of 1960) read with Article I of Chapter XII of the Statutes.
Rajendra College founded by public charities; first Governing Body formed by citizens of Chapra on July 31, 1938, consisting of 18 members.
Governing Body functioned until July 24, 1940, with additions; in 1941, adopted constitution framed by Principal; amendments in 1950.
After University of Bihar Act, 1951, and Chapter XIII of Statutes, Governing Body modified constitution to align with it.
Appellant Bisheshwar Dayal Sinha elected Secretary of Governing Body on June 3, 1961; term three academic sessions until May 31, 1964.
Vice-Chancellor of Bihar University issued order on January 13, 1963, directing reconstitution of Governing Body of Rajendra College and removing appellant as Secretary, appointing another.
Appellant filed writ petition in Patna High Court challenging validity of Vice-Chancellor's order and relevant new statutes as ultra vires.
Four other petitions filed seeking similar relief.
Patna High Court dismissed appellant's writ petition and others on December 23, 1963.
Appeal by special leave to Supreme Court.
New Statutes promulgated by Vice-Chancellor on November 18, 1962, including Clause 2(4) and Clause 3(1).
Vice-Chancellor empowered under Section 60(ii) to make adaptations/modifications in pre-existing statutes with Chancellor's approval; came into force March 1, 1962.
Section 35 of Act II of 1962 dissolved prior Senate, Syndicate, Academic Council; Vice-Chancellor to exercise powers pending reconstitution for up to 9 months.
Registrar wrote to Secretaries/Principals of admitted colleges enquiring action on constitutions.

Impugned order directed reconstitution with immediate effect, retained two staff representatives, added five persons, changed three seats for Founders/Donors, continued one co-opted member, terminated appellant as Secretary.
High Court held Statute 3(1) not applicable due to no opportunity given, but upheld under Statute 2(4) and Section 60(ii).
Appellant contended Senate reconstituted first week November 1962, notice for meeting November 30, 1962 issued November 8, 1962; Vice-Chancellor's power under s.35 ended.
High Court rejected above on ground Senate not duly constituted due to pending application of Baleshwar Prasad Choudhary and stay order.

legal_issues.text: Whether the new Statutes 2(4) and 3(1) framed by Vice-Chancellor are ultra vires the Bihar State Universities Act, 1960.
Whether the impugned order of Vice-Chancellor dated January 13, 1963, directing reconstitution of Governing Body of Rajendra College is valid.
Whether Vice-Chancellor's power under s.35 Act II 1962 and s.60(ii) justified the statutes and order.

petitioner_arguments.text: Relevant new statutes ultra vires Vice-Chancellor's authority; impugned order illegal, inoperative, void.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Bihar State Universities Act XIV of 1960, s.30(d)

petitioner_arguments.text: Senate reconstituted before November 18, 1962; Vice-Chancellor's power under s.35 ended.

respondent_arguments.text: Impugned statutes and order valid under powers to adapt/modify pre-existing statutes and s.35.
Vice-Chancellor compelled to act due to mismanagement and law/order problem at college.
Insufficient evidence Senate reconstituted before statutes promulgated.

court_reasoning.text: Act distinguishes between colleges instituted/maintained by University (s.30(e)) and admitted/affiliated colleges (s.30(d)); University cannot manage or reconstitute Governing Bodies of affiliated colleges, only impose conditions for affiliation.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Statute 2(4) inconsistent with s.30(d), empowers Vice-Chancellor to amend/revise constitutions of affiliated colleges' Governing Bodies, ultra vires.

court_reasoning.text: Impugned order went beyond even Statute 2(4) by terminating specific members, not just amending constitution.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Order directs specific reconstitution, nominates/terminates persons, inconsistent with affiliated college autonomy.

court_reasoning.text: s.60(ii) adaptations cannot validate invalid statute; High Court erred in obliterating distinction between categories of colleges.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Power under s.60(ii) read with s.30(d), not s.30(e).

court_reasoning.text: Statute 3(1) invalid insofar as it empowers Syndicate to dissolve/reconstitute Governing Body of affiliated colleges or cancel grant-in-aid for non-compliance.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Same infirmity as 2(4); University can impose conditions, disaffiliate for non-compliance, but not directly manage.

court_reasoning.text: No opinion on mismanagement facts as disputed and not decided by High Court; assumes bona fides but power not available under Act.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Legislature may amend Act for emergencies, but current Act does not permit.

court_reasoning.text: Insufficient material to decide if Senate reconstituted before November 18, 1962; High Court finding not binding.

holdings.text: Statute 2(4) invalid as ultra vires s.30(d) of the Act.
Impugned order invalid and inoperative as based on invalid Statute 2(4).
Statute 3(1) invalid insofar as empowers dissolution/reconstitution of Governing Body and cancellation of grant-in-aid under 3(1)(a) for non-compliance.

statutes_cited.name: Bihar State Universities Act (Bihar Act XIV of 1960)
statutes_cited.relevance: Governs universities, colleges, powers of Senate/Syndicate/Vice-Chancellor, statutes for affiliated vs instituted colleges; distinction key to invalidity.

statutes_cited.name: University of Bihar Act (Bihar Act XXVII of 1951)
statutes_cited.relevance: Predecessor Act; constitution aligned with its statutes.

statutes_cited.name: Bihar Act II of 1962
statutes_cited.relevance: Dissolved prior bodies, empowered Vice-Chancellor pending reconstitution for 9 months.

statutes_cited.name: Bihar Act XI of 1962, XIII of 1962, XVII of 1962
statutes_cited.relevance: Amending Acts bringing provisions into force.

outcome.summary: Appeal allowed; Patna High Court order set aside; appellant's writ petition allowed; respondents restrained from giving effect to impugned order (Annexure A) as it and Statutes 2(4), part of 3(1) invalid.
outcome.relief_granted: Quashing of impugned order; declaration of invalidity of Statute 2(4) and part of 3(1).
outcome.costs: Appellant entitled to costs from respondent No.1.

key_quotes.text: The Act proceeds on a broad and well-recognised distinction between two categories of collegiate institutions, one instituted by the University and the other admitted to the University or affiliated to it.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Core reasoning distinguishing powers over affiliated vs. constituent colleges.

key_quotes.text: The University may insist upon the observance of conditions in respect of the composition of the Governing Bodies, but it cannot direct the composition of the Governing Bodies itself the two powers are distinct and separate.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Explains limits of University's power over affiliated colleges' autonomy.

key_quotes.text: Statute 2(4) is invalid, and the impugned order passed under it is, therefore, invalid and inoperative.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Direct holding on key statute and order.
